title: Blended Learning Design for SA Tool Utilization in Higher Education Science Fields

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Workplace science data analysis competency enhancement program for employees

learning_goals: Using science domain SA (Scholarly Analytics) tools, learners can improve the qualitative/quantitative outcomes of annotation by at least 20% when analyzing research papers or reports.

Graduate students can establish self-directed learning plans including specific learning goals, weekly schedules, and progress-checking criteria every four weeks using SA (Self-Assessment) tools (e.g., Google Forms, LMS-built-in evaluation modules) in blended learning environments, achieve over 80% plan adherence during a six-month course, and write weekly reflection journals.
Learners enhance their scientific reasoning skills based on data visualization results derived from SA (Situational Analysis) tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
